CatDescriptText: Mr. Edward Buchanan, engineering firm employee, Homewood and Mrs. Cora Roser, housewife, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 4, 1962, pg. 15 with question: "Do you think stricter laws should be passed limiting the testing of experimental drugs on the public in light of the recent discovery that a sedative called thalidomide causes babies to be born with deformed legs and arms?"  Mr. Buchanan's answer reads: "I do.  I don't see how any particular person's to blame for this one."  Mrs. Roser's answer reads: "I do.  It's a tragedy that these children will have to be born deformed."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Edward Buchanan wearing light colored zippered jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Cora Roser carrying straw handbag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
